meet your new frosty friend — the **wheat stitch™ snowman**! this cozy winter project combines the texture of my **[signature wheat stitch™][1]**, handmade charm, and playful personality in one adorable crochet creation. perfect for holiday decorating or gifting, this snowman will melt hearts faster than hot cocoa on christmas morning.

you’ll start with the carrot nose (because every snowman needs a strong first impression! ), then crochet the body all in one piece — no chilly gaps or sewing separate parts. add cute twine “x” buttons for rustic flair and stitch the nose right in place as you go. once your snow buddy is assembled, crochet a snug little hat and scarf to keep them toasty through the season. add one of the adorable printable tags for even more fun!

[a video tutorial is included in the pattern.][2]

**crochet hook:** 
[g (4.0mm) & g+/7 (4.5mm) - or size to meet gauge][3]

**notions:**
[removable stitch markers][4] 
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5] 
[scissors][6]
[string for tags][7]
[fiberfill][8]

**yarn:**
[herrschners worsted 8 sparkle][9]
92% acrylic/8% polyester, 489ds/226g
in white 

with accessories in

[herrschners worsted 8][10]
100% acrylic, 489yds/226g
in clay, dark grey, and icy teal

**yarn quantities:**
snowman body:  165 yds
hat: 50 yds
scarf: 10 yds

**yarn substitutions:**
[brava worsted][11] - 100% premium acrylic, 218yds/100g

[herrschners worsted 3][12] - 100% acrylic, 183yds/85g

[brava tweed][13] - 97% premium acrylic/3% viscose, 218yds/100g

[red heart super saver metallic][14] - 92% acrylic/2% other fibers, 255yd/142g

one of the great things about crocheting amigurumi is the freedom to experiment with any yarn you love — from fingering weight to bulky! simply adjust your hook size to match your yarn choice, and have fun creating!

**abbreviations:**
blo- back loop only
ch - chain
flo - front loop onlyrs - right side
sc - single crochet
sc2tog - single crochet 2 together
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

**gauge:**
not critical for this design.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post:  [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][15]

**one size:**
10” x 5.5”

**skill level:**
advanced beginner/intermediate
